greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{d|n} Kronecker(-9, d).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
formula: a(n) is multiplicative with a(2^e) = e + 1, a(3^e) = 1, a(p^e) = e + 1 if p == 1 (mod 4), a(p^e) = (1 + (-1)^e) / 2 if p == 3 (mod 4) and p > 3.
Dirichlet g.f.: zeta(s) * L(chi,s) where chi(n) = Kronecker(-9, n). Sum_{n>0} a(n) / n^s = Product_{p prime} 1 / ((1 - p^-s) * (1 - Kronecker(-9, p) * p^-s)). (End)
mathematica: a[ n_] := If[ n < 1, 0, Sum[ KroneckerSymbol[ -9, d], { d, Divisors[ n]}]] (* _Michael Somos_, Jun 24 2011 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<1, 0, sumdiv( n, d, kronecker( -9, d)))} \\ _Michael Somos_, Jun 24 2011
(PARI) {a(n) = if( n<1, 0, direuler( p=2, n, 1 / ((1 - X) * (1 - kronecker( -9, p) * X))) [n])} \\ _Michael Somos_, Jun 24 2011

(PARI) {a(n) = local(A, p, e); if( n<0, 0, A = factor(n); prod(k=1, matsize(A)[1], if(p = A[k, 1], e = A[k, 2]; if( p==2, e+1, if( p==3, 1, if( p%4==1, e+1, (1 + (-1)^e)/2))))))} \\ _Michael Somos_, Jun 24 2011
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
